English: It's me. I trust the manhunt's going well?
Chinese:
是我。
找尋犯人還順利嗎？
German: Ich bin’s. Ich hoffe, dass die Suche gut läuft?

English:
...So Kayaba wasn't the guy either, huh? Then I'll
tell you the name of the next target.
Chinese:
……這樣啊，茅場也不是犯人嗎。
那麼我告訴你下一位目標吧。
Korean:
…그런가. 카야바도 범인이 아니었나.
그러면 다음 타깃을 가르쳐주지
German:
... Kayaba war es also auch nicht, was? Dann
nenne ich dir den Namen der nächsten Zielperson.

English: How exactly do you select the target?
Chinese: 選擇目標的基準是什麼？
German: Wie genau suchst du dir das Ziel aus?

English: Why would you ask something like that?
German: Warum fragst du mich so etwas?

English:
...You've started to doubt the authenticity of my
intel, from the looks of things.
Chinese:
……原來如此，
開始懷疑我的情報是真是假了啊。
Korean:
……과연.
내 정보의 진위를 의심하기 시작한 모양이군
German:
... Anscheinend zweifelst du jetzt den
Wahrheitsgehalt meiner Informationen an.

English:
You want to meet in person and talk? Guess that
means you won't trust me unless we do.
Chinese:
……想和我直接面對面談嗎……
你的意思是，不這麼做的話就無法相信我對吧。
Korean:
……나와 직접 만나 대화하고 싶다는 건가.
그렇지 않으면 신뢰할 수 없다는 말이로군
German:
Du willst, dass wir uns treffen und unterhalten?
Das heißt wohl, vorher traust du mir nicht.

English:
...You seem like an excellent hacker, one worthy
of my trust. This much is true.
Chinese: ……確實，你看起來是值得相信的優秀駭客。
Korean: ……확실히 너는 신뢰를 얻어둘 만한 우수한 해커로 보인다
German:
... Du scheinst ein ausgezeichneter Hacker zu
sein, einer, der mein Vertrauen verdient.
So weit, so gut.

English: Very well. Let's talk in person.
German: Na schön. Unterhalten wir uns unter vier Augen.

English:
I'll see you tomorrow...
I'll be waiting at the EDEN Open Space.
Chinese:
那麼明天——
我會在EDEN的開放空間等你。
Korean:
그러면 내일――
EDEN의 오픈 스페이스에서 기다리고 있겠다
German:
Bis morgen dann ...
Ich werde im Offenen Raum von EDEN warten.

English:
(Tomorrow, huh... I don't know what'll happen.
I'd better prepare accordingly.)
Chinese:
（明天嗎……會發生什麼事還不知道，
　盡力做好準備再赴約吧）
Korean:
(내일인가…… 무슨 일이 일어날지 알 수 없다.
 최대한 준비를 해두자)
German:
(Morgen, hm ... Ich weiß nicht, was passieren
wird. Ich sollte mich lieber gut vorbereiten.)
